Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for the Azure Route Server deployment, including routing needs, supported protocols, and integration with existing on-premises or cloud networks.
Design the network architecture to include Azure Route Server, ensuring compatibility with existing network topology and routing protocols such as BGP.
Secure necessary approvals and authorizations, such as budgetary and compliance approvals, for deploying Azure Route Server.
Deploy Azure Route Server in the desired virtual network using the Azure portal, CLI, or PowerShell.
Set up BGP peering between Azure Route Server and your network devices. Ensure proper configuration of Autonomous System Numbers (ASNs) and IP addresses.
Apply security best practices, such as Network Security Groups (NSGs) and route filtering, to secure the Azure Route Server deployment.
Perform thorough testing of routing and connectivity, including failover scenarios, to ensure the Azure Route Server is functioning as expected.
Set up monitoring and alerting for Azure Route Server using Azure Monitor and Network Watcher. Configure alerts for routing issues and performance metrics.
Document the Azure Route Server configuration, routing policies, and operational procedures. Share the documentation with the operations team.
Provide training to the operations team on managing and troubleshooting Azure Route Server.
Conduct regular audits to ensure the Azure Route Server setup complies with organizational and regulatory requirements.
Periodically review and update the Azure Route Server configuration to align with evolving network requirements.
Use Azure Monitor and Network Watcher to continuously monitor the health and status of the Azure Route Server. Identify and investigate any anomalies or potential issues.
Check the stability of BGP sessions between Azure Route Server and connected routers. Monitor for route flaps or unexpected changes in route advertisements.
Analyze Azure Route Server performance data to ensure operations within expected parameters. Investigate and address any performance deviations.
Perform failover tests to verify that redundant paths function correctly and can take over in case of primary path failures.
Review and update security policies, Network Security Groups (NSGs), and access controls to adapt to changes in the Azure Route Server network or security landscape.
Conduct audits of Azure Route Server configurations to ensure alignment with documented architecture and best practices for the service.
Perform regular compliance checks to ensure the Azure Route Server setup adheres to relevant regulations and industry standards.
Conduct incident response drills to prepare the team for potential security incidents or Azure Route Server network outages. Ensure familiarity with procedures and protocols.
Evaluate the SLA performance of the Azure Route Server connectivity provider. Address any issues or deviations from the agreed SLA metrics.
Develop and execute plans for Azure Route Server upgrades or expansions as needed. Ensure minimal disruption during these activities.

Regularly back up configurations of on-premises routers, firewalls, and other critical network devices connected to Azure Route Server. Ensure secure and accessible storage of backups for potential restoration.
Collect and analyze user feedback regarding Azure Route Server performance and reliability. Implement continuous improvements based on this feedback.
